[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: internal()] [Critical Information Leak] Does the internal() function expose detailed error information from anyhow::Error that could reveal critical internal state about consensus failures, storage corruption, or validator malfunction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: internal()] [Stack Trace Disclosure] Can anyhow::Error objects passed to internal() contain stack traces or debug information that leak internal code paths, function names, or implementation details useful for exploit development? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: internal()] [Error Escalation] Can attackers deliberately trigger internal errors via malformed requests to cause 500 errors, potentially indicating vulnerable code paths or triggering error handling that degrades system performance? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: status_code()] [Invalid Code Fallback] Does the unwrap_or(StatusCode::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR) fallback in status_code() properly handle all edge cases, or can invalid u16 values cause status code confusion where errors are misclassified? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: status_code()] [Error Masking] Can the fallback to INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR in status_code() mask specific error conditions like authentication failures or rate limiting, making it harder to detect and respond to attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: status_code()] [Undefined Behavior] Does StatusCode::from_u16() handle all possible u16 values correctly, or can values outside the valid HTTP status code range cause panics or undefined behavior when converted? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: aptos_ledger_version()] [State Oracle] Does exposing ledger version in error responses via aptos_ledger_version() create an oracle that allows attackers to precisely track blockchain state progression and transaction timing? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: aptos_ledger_version()] [Version Spoofing] Can malicious code set arbitrary ledger versions via aptos_ledger_version(), potentially misleading clients about the actual blockchain state or causing consensus confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Trait: Display, Function: fmt()] [Newline Injection] Can attackers inject newline characters in error messages that break log parsing when fmt() outputs multi-line error strings with ledger version information? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Trait: Display, Function: fmt()] [Log Injection] Does the Display implementation allow CRLF injection or ANSI escape sequences in error messages that could corrupt logs, bypass log analysis tools, or inject fake log entries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Trait: Reject] [Warp Integration] Does implementing Reject for Error allow these error objects to bypass warp's standard error handling, potentially causing errors to be handled inconsistently across the API? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Trait: Reject] [Error Propagation] Can implementing Reject cause errors to propagate through warp filters in unexpected ways, potentially exposing internal errors or bypassing security checks in middleware? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Trait: From<anyhow::Error>] [Error Context Loss] Can the From conversion from anyhow::Error lose important error context like error codes, causes, or backtrace information that would be useful for debugging security incidents? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Trait: From<anyhow::Error>] [Information Disclosure] Does automatically converting anyhow::Error via From expose internal error details that should be sanitized before being returned to API clients? (Medium)
